item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tony Stewart sets mark with 5th Watkins Glen victory
item.description: Tony Stewart has won the rain-delayed NASCAR Sprint Cup race at Watkins Glen International.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Cabbie's attorney says Patrick Kane incident overblown
item.description: The attorney for a cab driver who says he was beaten up by Patrick Kane and his cousin over pocket change said the incident had been blown out of proportion.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Boston Celtics re-sign free-agent power forward Glen 'Big Baby' Davis
item.description: The Celtics are bringing back Glen "Big Baby" Davis, announcing Monday that they've re-signed the power forward to a new deal. It's reportedly for two years.

item.dc:creator: ESPNChicago.com
item.title: Major League Baseball is looking into comments made by Chicago White Sox manager Ozzie Guillen about retaliating against teams that hit his players
item.description: Major League Baseball is looking into comments made by Chicago White Sox manager Ozzie Guillen about retaliating against teams that hit his players.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Philadelphia Phillies to start Pedro Martinez vs. Chicago Cubs, put Jamie Moyer in bullpen
item.description: The Phillies announced that they will start Pedro Martinez Wednesday against the Cubs and send Jamie Moyer to the bullpen.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: NBA free agents: Denver Nuggets forward Linas Kleiza takes Olympiakos' offer
item.description: Denver Nuggets forward Linas Kleiza is on his way to Greece after signing a two-year contract worth $12.2 million with Olympiakos on Monday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Notre Dame coach Charlie Weis: Leg better, sideline presence more likely
item.description: Notre Dame coach Charlie Weis is feeling good about his health as well as his team.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Kevin Kolb, defensive end Trent Cole injured at practice
item.description: Two more Philadelphia Eagles have gone down during an injury-filled training camp.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Cleveland Browns coach Eric Mangini disputes claims by agent over receiver Syndric Steptoe's injury
item.description: Cleveland Browns coach Eric Mangini has disputed an agent's claim that reserve receiver Syndric Steptoe suffered a season-ending injury because of a bad practice decision.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Swimmer Dara Torres flew with helicopter pilot days before Hudson crash
item.description: Dara Torres says she took a New York helicopter tour last week with the same pilot who died in a crash with a small plane over the Hudson River.

item.dc:creator: Adam Rittenberg
item.title: Police: Ex-Michigan Wolverine Justin Feagin in failed drug deal
item.description: Police reports show that Justin Feagin was dismissed from the Michigan football team after an alleged failed drug deal.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Accused shooter of Chargers rookie Curtis Brinkley in custody
item.description: A Philadelphia man accused of shooting San Diego Chargers rookie Curtis Brinkley has turned himself in to authorities.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Source: Ohio State linebacker Tyler Moeller likely to miss season with head injury
item.description: Ohio State's Tyler Moeller was expected to miss the season after suffering a serious head injury, ESPN's Joe Schad confirmed Monday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Russian investigators reopen Alexei Cherepanov probe
item.description: Prosecutors will reopen the investigation into the death of New York Rangers draft pick Alexei Cherepanov, who collapsed during a Continental Hockey League game last year in Russia.
